entry.title: Re: LTL version supported for Sybase ASE 16.0 and later v...
entry.content:
FWIW,

That LTL Compatibility matrix (Repserver Design Guide) is a reference for Replication Server and the standalone Rep Agent software.

The standalone Rep Agent software was used against heterogeneous PDBs (eg, DB2, Oracle and MS SQL Server).  I say 'was' because heterogeneous db support was officially killed a few years ago, while actual/new development on the standalone Rep Agent software ended even further back (15.7 SP 20x).

The lack of new standalone Rep Agent software development appears to coincide with the lack of updates to that LTL Compatibility matrix.

--------------

If you have a support contract you may be able to a) search for KBs that address the issue or b) open a case with tech support.

In the meantime you could hobble together bit-n-pieces: a) (ASE) dbcc gettrunc output includes the repagent's LTL version (at least when running in LTL mode); b) the ASE errorlog will list repagent and repserver LTL versions in a warning message when the repagent's LTL version is greater than the repserver's LTL version.  With this info it would be possible to fill in an LTL compatibility matrix by testing all of your ASE/repagent versions against all of your Repserver versions.

entry.content:
Hi @Ester2 

You're absolutely right with your findings.

Please note, the configuration activity Assign eDocument Type to Accounting Document Type (T003EDOCV) is only available for standard FI and SD billing document types in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. Unfortunately, FIâ€‘CA document types are not supported for this mapping in Public Cloud as of now which is controlled by scope items like 5XU and 78L.â€‚

The following are the facts:

  • FIâ€‘CA invoices are currently treated under the generic SII Outgoing Invoice classification for eDocument processing.
  • Thereâ€™s no available scope item or configuration toggle to assign a specific SII eDocument type for FIâ€‘CA source documents (unlike the onâ€‘premise SPRO configuration).

That behaviour is consistent with the current SAPâ€™s delivered model in Public Cloud. If itâ€™s a critical legal requirement, it might need to be raised as a customer enhancement request with SAP.

The following documents will help you answer potential further questions.

Assigning eDocument Type to Accounting Document Type (Mandatory)

Electronic Invoicing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

Hope that clarifies things. happy to assist further for your specific local compliance scenario.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Try the latest AI features in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508
entry.content:
The 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contains enhancements to popular AI features and new natural language interaction options that help you work more intelligently and intuitively.

Weâ€™ve spent the past 6 months since the 2502 release working with your feedback â€“ from beta programs, to roundtable discussions in the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum, to one-on-one meetings with customers â€“ to learn how we can help you achieve more with the help of AI in your system. Letâ€™s take a look at whatâ€™s new, update you on the commercialization of some features, and give you resources for getting involved with our upcoming beta program. 

Natural language filtering now supports a wider range of queries

The AI-assisted easy filter (first released in 2502) enables you to filter list reports in your SAP Fiori elements-based apps using natural language. This simplifies how you access the information you need and reduces the training time required to pick up new applications delivered by SAP.

AI-assisted easy filter enables natural language filtering of pages with lists of business objects. Here the user can filter for a given sold-to party using plain language rather than needing to know its key..

For 2508, weâ€™ve made a number of enhancements to make interactions with AI-assisted easy filter even more intuitive:

  1. Tables can be filtered without needing to know an objectâ€™s specific key. Instead, simply enter the name of the object you are looking for. The AI-assisted easy filter will map that text to the intended key and apply it to the filter fields for you, which is a much more natural way to search for information. In the event that there are multiple keys with similar names, you will receive results filtered for those names. As before, you can always refine your results in the input field or using the classic filtering.
  2. Weâ€™ve also worked to ensure parity between the filter fields that can be applied using the AI-assisted easy filter and the classic filter bar. Some users had reported that, in some cases, AI-assisted easy filter would not apply queries to certain filters. This was caused by the fact that some of the filter fields used navigation paths to different entities instead of the main entity for the app. This scenario is now supported and you can filter on any property present in the classic filter bar.

My Home Personalization with Insights Cards supports more apps and a new way to query for cards

The ability to create Insights cards and quickly add them to My Home now supports 20 SAP Fiori apps.

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards was released as a Joule capability as part of its 2503 release. The functionality allows end users to query Joule for business data they regularly need using natural language. The output is displayed as a card that can be added to their My Home page for easy reference. This makes it easier for users to access information they need to make everyday business decisions and move processes forward.

This functionality was initially limited to 9 applications. With the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, this coverage has been extended to 11 additional applications. This gives users easier and wider access to the business data that is important to them. AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for Insights cards now supports the following applications:

  1. Find Maintenance Order
  2. Find Maintenance Order and Operation
  3. Maintain Bill Of Material
  4. Manage Business Partner Master Data
  5. Manage Customer Returns
  6. Manage Manual Reservations
  7. Manage Material Coverage (Version 2)
  8. Manage Outbound Deliveries
  9. Manage Product Master Data
  10. Manage Purchase Orders (Version 2)
  11. Manage Purchase Requisitions - Professional
  12. Manage Sales Orders
  13. Manage Sales Orders - Version 2
  14. Manage Sales Quotation - Version 2
  15. Manage Supplier Master Data
  16. Manage Usage Decisions
  17. Material Documents Overview
  18. Project Control - Enterprise Projects
  19. Reproceess Failed Material Movements
  20. Supplier Invoices List (Version 2)

Users can now use natural language to create and add Insights Cards directly in My Home.

For the 2508 release, we have also introduced a new way to create Insights cards using natural language: you can access the feature directly from My Home. This gives users the flexibility to choose the personalization option that works best for them, giving them access to the information they need at a glance.

If you'd like to read even more exciting updates about features and functionality included in the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, check out the following fantastic blogs from my colleagues:

  • For a general overview of new functionality: Highlights of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 release 
  • For a few more AI uses cases, some focused on particular business processes: Exploring AI and next-gen Cloud ERP innovations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 

Commercialization update: New Base AI includes common AI functions at no additional cost

For the 2508 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a number of AI solutions have been added to its Base AI offering. This means that you can use the features absolutely free of charge. You simply need to sign the SAP AI terms here and SAP will handle the activation for you.

Included in the Base AI offering for this release are AI-assisted easy filter and AI-assisted smart summarization, as well as AI-assisted enterprise search (which allows you to look up data from the search in My Home). Give them a try!

Try out upcoming AI innovations in the 2508 beta

For customers looking to try out the absolute latest in AI innovations, registration for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta is still open. This is your opportunity to try out and give feedback on new use cases for AI in your system. The solutions up for beta testing are free to use for the duration of the program.  Below is a preview of some of the features that will be available. Please note: Customer/partner participation will be at the discretion of the Beta Testing Program team. Participants must use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition productively. Future developments are at the discretion of SAP and their details and delivery dates may be changed at any time.

Resolve situations directly in My Home without navigating to applications

AI-assisted smart solution for situations in My Home allows you to quickly take action on business processes that need your attention directly in My Home..

The Situations tab in My Home provides quick summaries of business processes that need to be addressed in your system. Previously, this meant reading the alert on the tile, navigating to the required app(s), and making the required changes. With AI-assisted Smart Solution for Situations in My Home, weâ€™re streamlining how you take action on these scenarios. Youâ€™ll now be able to see a summary of the situation, start the relevant business process from quick actions on the card, and even make changes to the business data all without leaving your My Home page. This allows you to stay on top of your business and resolve potential issues even faster.

Streamline data entry in object pages

AI-assisted easy fill streamlines data entry by populating object pages based on natural language input (for example: emails or messages from colleagues).

Depending on your business scenario, SAP Fiori object pages can sometimes be quite complex. Data entry might mean filling a field at the top of the screen, scrolling for several sections to add more information, and so on. AI-assisted easy fill enables you to enter your updates into a single field using natural language. The solution then maps your input to the proper fields, highlights any potential inconsistencies that may need to be addressed, and â€“ after your review â€“ updates the fields. This will help speed up data entry and reduce training time for new users.

Resolve error messages with AI assistance

AI-assisted error explanation provides resolution recommendations to error and warning messages in your system.

Learning new business processes can be tricky. AI-assisted error explanation uses AI to generate explanations and suggest resolutions for errors that are triggered in your system. This streamlines how you handle errors and reduces training time, making you more productive and helping you pick up processes even faster; in addition to reducing your organizationâ€™s support load.

Search for applications you need using natural language

AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications allows you to search for applications using natural language.

When learning a new business process or stepping into a new role, it can sometimes be challenging to find the exact application you need to carry out a task. With AI-assisted smart personalization of My Home for applications, you can search for the app you need using natural language. Simply type in what you need to do and get served the required application, which you can add to your My Home page with a single click. This allows you to access the applications you need without needing to know the exact application name.

We want to hear from you!

Whether you take advantage of the new free features in the Base AI package, subscribe to cutting edge technologies, or choose to take part in a beta program; we want to hear what you think about these solutions! Give them a try and share your feedback below or with the product team. Your experience is critical to understanding how we can make these innovations even better for you.

When youâ€™re ready to get involved, you can:

  1. Register to use base AI features
  2. Sign up for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition beta
  3. Join the Public Cloud Practitioner Forum (for customers live on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

Happy experimenting! Weâ€™ll be back with another update for the 2602 release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 - DTW - Purchasing UOM Codes
entry.content:
Hi Brian,

Thanks for the update, and you're on the right track.

However, the key information you're missing is that the conversion factor between the BaseQty and AltQty is not stored in ITM12. Instead, it is defined in the UoM Group setup, particularly in the table OUOM and UOM1, which are used during item master setup and control how many base units are in an alternate unit.

Please note: If the BaseQty/AltQty mapping was never set in the UoM Group, youâ€™ll get the item-UoM relationship, but the system wonâ€™t understand the conversion you require, which might be why DTW or UoM behaviour is inconsistent.

Moving forward, the ITM12 table reflects the relationship between the item and the UoM entries, but it doesnâ€™t store the actual conversion factors (BaseQty/AltQty).

Those are defined in the UoM Group setup itself and specifically in the UoM Group Master, which is stored in tables like OUOM/UOM1.

I will suggest checking the following:

  1. Go into the UoM Group definition for 6-CS/PK and make sure that:
    • BaseQty = 6 (i.e., 6 EACH in 1 CASE)
    • AltQty = 1
  2. Double-check that the item 20011C is assigned to the correct UoM Group (6-CS/PK) and that the Purchasing/Sales UoMs align with the group.

Once the UoM Group is set up properly, DTW or manual entry will respect the Base/Alt conversion logic.

 

Let me know if this helps solve that issue.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Using conda-forge in SAP Business Application Studio â€“ my notes
entry.content:
In my previous blog posts, I focused on Using Python in SAP Business Application Studio and Using Jupyter in SAP Business Application Studio with Python's virtual environments. But SAP Business Application Studio (referred to as "BAS" below) also allows you to work with the Conda environments:

Usually, Conda is used when one needs binary package management, and installation with pip fails because of the build requirements that cannot be successfully completed with the tools and authorizations one has in their BAS dev space.

ðŸ‘‰At the time of writing this post, using Conda might require additional commercial licenses from Anaconda, Inc. if downloading their tools and/or packages from their `default` channel. This might be a valid case for you, but this blog post covers only the use of the community-driven `conda-forge` channel, and the minimum tools required to use it. To the best of my knowledge, I discuss only the technical setup here, but you might need to check any license implications for the dependencies of a project you are working on.

Install miniforge

Follow the installation steps, for example from https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge?tab=readme-ov-file#unix-like-platforms-macos-linux--wsl

Download and run the installation script.

curl --location --remote-name --output-dir ~/tmp "https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Miniforge3-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh"

bash ~/tmp/Miniforge3-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh -b

 Configure conda

Activate conda and its base environment.

eval "$(/home/user/miniforge3/bin/conda shell.$(basename "${SHELL}") hook)"

 Initialize conda (it will add the shell's integration).

conda init

To prevent the conda's `base` environment from being activated on startup (because it will be taken care of by the Python extension), run the following command:

conda config --set auto_activate_base false

For changes to take effect, close and re-open your current shell.

Update conda's base environment to the latest packages from the community-maintained conda-forge channel.

conda update -n base --all --yes

You can also use the faster mamba command instead of conda. Both are parts of the Miniforge installation.

Point Python extension to your Conda executable

In Terminal, check the location of the conda command, which should be something like /home/user/miniforge3/condabin/conda:

which conda

 In Settings, open python.condaPath and switch to the Remote tab. Input the value.

Create a .conda environment in your project

Open your project folder in BAS.

From the command palette, start the command Python: Create Environment..., then Conda environment type...

...and select the required Python version from the list:

You should see the message that the environment is created and set as the active one for the project.

Open a new Terminal session, and you should see the `.conda` environment set.

You can check the list of environments with the command:

conda env list

Install IPyKernel in your .conda environment

Unlike in a "venv" virtual environment, the Python extension does not automatically install IPyKernel in a conda environment. You need to install it manually.

In Terminal, run the command 

conda install ipykernel --yes

Check with the command

conda list ipykernel

Select the .conda env in your notebook

Now, you can open your project's Jupyter notebook, select the .conda environment, and execute the code ðŸ¤“

You should be ready to work with conda-forge in SAP Business Application Studio now!

Please share your tips in the comments!

------

-Vitaliy, aka @Sygyzmundovych

entry.title: Re: No Assignment Group in Ariba CIM for central Invoice...
entry.content:
Hi @ChristianHeck 

Thanks for providing the screenshots and details, itâ€™s really helpful. I located your scenario on the official SAP Community, and hereâ€™s what was confirmed:

In reference to SAP documentation and community posts, it clearly states that the Assignment Group field in the Manage Supplier Invoices Centrally app does depend on groups being assigned in the Central Invoice Management (CIM) system via Cloud Identity Services (IAS).

However, simply synchronizing the groups and users from IAS does not guarantee the Assignment Group will be recognized in the Fiori app. The aggregation rules must be configured too.â€‚          No Assignment Group in Ariba CIM for central Invoice Management App

If the transformation logic or CIM group mapping is misconfigured, then groups even if they begin with CIM_may not filter properly.

However, you are on the right path with IAS user and group synchronization, but I found that the groups are not appearing because assignment group rules havenâ€™t been set up in CIM.

To fix the issue I suggest you carry out the following:

  1. In your IAS transformation, verify that you are mapping the group.id values properly to the CIM_... The format expected by Ariba CIM orange outlines suggest schema mismatches.
  2. In Ariba Central Invoice Management, go to Configure Assignment Group Rules and create rules mapping your supplier invoices to the CIM_ group names and users.

Once the transformation and assignment group rules are correctly configured, your CIM_ groups should appear in the â€œAssignment Groupâ€ filter dropdown in the Manage Supplier Invoices Centrally app.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Crystal reports; how to only include rows that have a...
entry.content:
Add the table a second time to the report. This would create an alias (e.g. YourTable1).

Join YourTable to YourTable2 on YourTable.LABOR = YourTable2.LABOR

Add a JOIN on YourTable.UniqueRowID <> YouTable2.LABOR
If your data source doesn't support <> join, add that condition to the record selection formula:
YourTable.UniqueRowID <> YouTable2.LABOR

entry.title: Re: Custom API based on BO with custom (read) logic
entry.content:
Thank you for your question, @EgbertVenema.

By now you may have found an answer elsewhere. Still, your question gives me the opportunity to try an AI-based response I solicited from Joule for Consultants, SAP's new-ish chat bot for implementers:

"Custom API Implementation Using Business Objects

You can use a combination of existing Business Object (BO) interfaces and custom CRUD methods, including custom read logic, in SAP's ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model (RAP). RAP offers both managed and unmanaged implementation types for business objects, with managed implementations automatically handling CRUD operations through the RAP framework and unmanaged implementations requiring manual code [1][2].

Managed BO Implementation:

  • The RAP framework automatically handles CRUD operations, allowing developers to focus on business logic[1].
  • You can modify the save sequence for specific use cases, such as adding custom save procedures[3].

Unmanaged BO Implementation:

  • Requires manual implementation of transactional logic in ABAP classes, offering full control over database operations and allowing integration of legacy code like BAPIs[2].
  • This approach is suitable for integrating existing business logic and handling complex interactions[4].

For your need to adjust the read logic in cloud environments, both methods can be applied, but if more flexibility is needed, incorporating custom read logic with unmanaged implementation might be preferred. Using managed implementation with additional or unmanaged save options allows customization in standard interactions.

A hybrid approach leveraging managed BOs with unmanaged save can also be considered to balance agility with the need for specific customizations[1][3]."

If this response was helpful to you, please mark it accordingly. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: update field of interna table from another internal t...
entry.content:
Thank you for your request, @vieet .

I am aware this might be late, and you probably got an answer to your question elsewhere by now. But it gives me an opportunity to try out a new AI chat bot we now have available for our partners and customers, Joule for Consultants. Her is Joule's take on your question: 
"Modern ABAP Syntax for Updating Internal Tables

To optimize performance and avoid the traditional LOOP-ENDLOOP construct, you can use the ABAP 7.4 and 7.5 syntax enhancements which simplify internal table manipulation. Below are a couple of approaches you can consider:

  1. Using Filter and LOOP Expressions: You can use filter expressions to find the relevant entries, then apply a FOR expression to update the fields.

     
1 DATA(result) = FILTER #( lt_final USING KEY key WHERE bukrs = bukrs AND belnr = belnr AND gjahr = gjahr AND buzei = buzei AND lifnr = lifnr ).
2
3 LOOP AT nt_final ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL().
4  UPDATE lt_final SET lt_final[ sy-tabix ]-remarks = -remarks WHERE lines( result ) > 0.
5 ENDLOOP.

  • Using FOR and VALUE Expressions: The FOR expression combined with VALUE can efficiently iterate and modify table entries without a loop.

     
1 lt_final = VALUE #( FOR ls_final IN lt_final
2                    LET matched = FILTER #( nt_final USING KEY key WHERE bukrs = ls_final-bukrs AND belnr = ls_final-belnr AND gjahr = ls_final-gjahr )
3                    IN ( remarks = COND #( WHEN lines( matched ) > 0 THEN ls_final-remarks ELSE ls_final-remarks ) ) ).

Here, COND helps decide whether to update the remarks based on a matching filter. This approach minimizes loop overhead and directly updates entries as needed.

These methods utilize advanced syntax features in ABAP versions 7.4 and 7.5, helping to improve code readability and performance [1]."   

Please verify AI-based responses. Try out and test your code based on this recommendation thoroughly.
If this answered your request, please mark the response accordingly. Thank you.

The question is asking: "Is there an API that allows external systems to query [automatic account determination]? Or, is there a CDS View that can be used for automatic account determination?"

Response in English:

Yes, SAP provides options for automatic account determination through CDS views and APIs. You can use specific CDS views like the I_CAAcctDetnTransKey for account determination transaction keys, which help define the type of automatic posting required in financial accounting. This CDS view can support various business scenarios by providing transaction keys needed for account determination [1]. Additionally, creating custom CDS views for external API use is supported in SAP, allowing integration with external systems [2].

entry.title: Re: In SAP CDS Views, the global search functionality is...
entry.content:
Thank you for your request, @Debashis2.

The following response is AI generated by SAP's "Joule for Consultants" chat bot. Please verify the response, accordingly.

"

Workaround for Global Search in CDS Views for Calculated Fields

Global search functionality in SAP CDS views does not support calculated or derived fields directly due to limitations in search annotations. Searching a calculated field is not feasible, as SAP allows only persisted fields in the database to be search-enabled [1].

To workaround these limitations, consider implementing the following options:

  1. Persist Calculated Values: If feasible, persist the calculated values in a physical field within the underlying database table. By storing the calculated values, you can then use search annotations like @Search.searchable: true and @Search.defaultSearchElement: true directly on persisted fields.

  2. Custom Filtering: Instead of a global search, introduce the calculated fields in a filter list. This approach allows users to filter data based on calculated attributes in the UI [1].

  3. Text Search with Associations: Use association with other CDS views that allow text searches, like I_TextObjectPlainLongText, to enable complex search scenarios. This requires additional setup in maintaining view associations but can provide a workaround where necessary [2].

These methods provide alternatives to achieve the desired search capabilities within the limitations of CDS views for calculated data."  

If this response answers your question, please mark it accordingly. Thank you.

entry.title: CPI Integration with BW/4HANA
entry.content:
Introduction

The below blog provides an overview of setting up a simple CPI integration to post data to a SAP BW/4HANA on-premise instance.  I have included an explanation of how to achieve this in both postman and SAP Cloud Integration.  I have also included references to helpful blogs you can refer to for additional details.

Set up in BW

Create DSO in BW

Ensure 'Write Interface Enabled' attribute is set.

Add fields to DSO

 

Download URL's shown on DSO

Get Structure

https://server:port/sap/bw4/v1/push/dataStores/da_maze

Get Sample Data

https://server:port/sap/bw4/v1/push/dataStores/da_maze/sampleData{?records,seed}

Send Data

https://server:port/sap/bw4/v1/push/dataStores/da_maze/dataSend{?request,datapid}

Open Request

https://server:port/sap/bw4/v1/push/dataStores/da_maze/requests

Close Request

https://server:port/sap/bw4/v1/push/dataStores/da_maze/requests/{request}/close{?error}

 

Using DSO in Postman

For Info can query DSO structure

Or see an example json payload

 

Post data in postman:

Step 1: Fetch CSRF token

Add header for x-csrf-token = fetch, set Authorization to basic Auth

Response header will contain the csrf token

Step 2: Send Data to BW

Add header x-csrf-token and set value returned by call in Step 1 (found in the response header)

Set body to message to post to BW (xml in this example)

Response back

Example JSON POST

 

Data Post example in CPI

The process below mirrors the process done previously in postman to post data to BW

 

Against the Integration flow set HTTP session

 

  1. Start Timer - Schedule set to Run Once
  2. Set Csrf token header

3. Make http call to get csrf token returned (note that in this example an on-premise BW is being called so virtual host/port have been set in cloud connector)

Make sure Headers are both passed to the call and returned

4. Handle Cookies - The initial csrf call returns an header called 'set-cookie', unfortunately the call to post the data requires an header called 'cookie'.  The groovy script converts the format and name.  More details can be found in https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/sci/3361897820.html?locale=en-US

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

def Message processData(Message message) {

    def headers = message.getHeaders();

    def cookies = headers.get("set-cookie");

    message.setHeader("cookie", String.join("; ", cookies));

return message;

}        

5. Set content type and payload of data post

6. HTTP call to post data to BW

 

Referenced Blogs:

Integrating with BW

From <https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-bw-4hana-write-interface-enabled-adso-connected-to-a-3rd-party-tool/ba-p/13482277>

Example CPI to BW

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-cloud-platform-integration-cpi-to-push-data-into-sap-bw-4hana/ba-p/13418310

Issues with x-csrf not working see below:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/x-csrf-token-with-on-premises-sap-system-using-http-receiver-adapter/ba-p/13533518

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/sci/3361897820.html?locale=en-US

entry.title: Re: License model of IAG
entry.content:
Hi, IAG license is bought by the customer deciding "a priori" if they use the integration edition or the standard one. It is not something that is measured after service activation and it is not based on any customer configuration.

The license metric for Integration edition is number of systems connected. The one for standard edition, instead, is based on resources (simply put, on number of monitored users).

Hope it helps

P.s. you can always check those information in the SAP Trust Center. For instance, supplements for IAG include information about the license metrics. You can find more information at the following link: https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/agreements/cloud/cloud-services.html?sort=latest_desc&search=Supplement%20identity%20access%20governance&tag=language:english-usa

entry.title: Building Collaborative Microservices in Python with FastAPI: Echo & Reverse Agents (Beginner -Part1)
entry.content:
Microservices encourage us to build distributed systems consisting of small, specialized components that communicate seamlessly. In this post, letâ€™s explore a simple yet illustrative example: Agent-A and Agent-B, two FastAPI-based Python microservices that interact in real-time.

We'll see how Agent-A receives a request, calls Agent-B, and returns a transformed responseâ€”demonstrating the foundations of service-to-service HTTP communication.

The Objective

We want to create:

  • Agent-B: A service that reverses text.
  • Agent-A: A service that takes a string, sends it to Agent-B for reversal, and returns the reversed string as a response.

Both services are built with FastAPI and use Pydantic for data validation.

Meet Agent-B: The Reverse Service

Let's begin by looking at agent_b.py. Itâ€™s a minimal service that exposes one endpoint that takes a string and returns it reversed.

from fastapi import FastAPI
from pydantic import BaseModel
import os

PORT = int(os.getenv("AGENT_B_PORT", 8001))
app = FastAPI(title="Agent-B")

class ReverseRequest(BaseModel):
    text: str

class ReverseResponse(BaseModel):
    source: str
    reversed: str

@app.post("/reverse", response_model=ReverseResponse)
def reverse(req: ReverseRequest):
    return ReverseResponse(source="Agent-B", reversed=req.text[::-1])

Meet Agent-A: The Forwarding Echo Service

Now, letâ€™s look at agent_a.py. While itâ€™s called an "echo" service, it doesnâ€™t simply echo back input. Instead, it forwards the input to Agent-B, receives the reversed string, and returns that. This demonstrates microservice orchestration.

agent_a.py

from fastapi import FastAPI
from pydantic import BaseModel
import httpx
import os

PORT = int(os.getenv("AGENT_A_PORT", 8000))
B_URL = os.getenv("AGENT_B_URL", "http://localhost:8001")
app = FastAPI(title="Agent-A")

class EchoRequest(BaseModel):
    text: str

class EchoResponse(BaseModel):
    source: str
    echoed: str

@app.post("/echo", response_model=EchoResponse)
async def echo(req: EchoRequest):
    # Forward the text to Agent-B
    async with httpx.AsyncClient() as client:
        r = await client.post(f"{B_URL}/reverse", json={"text": req.text})
        r.raise_for_status()
        reversed_text = r.json()["reversed"]
    # Respond with what Agent-B returned
    return EchoResponse(source="Agent-A", echoed=reversed_text)

 

Running Both Agents

  1. Start Agent-B:

    uvicorn agent_b:app --port 8001

  2. Start Agent-A:

    uvicorn agent_a:app --port 8000

     

Testing the System

Letâ€™s see the microservices in action with curl:

curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/echo \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     -d '{"text":"hello A2A"}'

Response:

{
  "source": "Agent-A",
  "echoed": "A2A olleh"
}

What happened?

  • The request hits Agent-Aâ€™s /echo.
  • Agent-A calls Agent-Bâ€™s /reverse with the payload.
  • Agent-B reverses the string.
  • Agent-A returns Agent-Bâ€™s output* as its own "echoed" field.

How to Extend This Example

  • Add Logging/Tracing: See the flow end-to-end.
  • Synchronous vs Asynchronous calls: Both are possible; here httpx with async enables efficient concurrency.
  • Error Handling: Add more robust logic in production.
  • Authentication: Secure the endpoints as needed.
  • More Agents: Build a family of collaborating services!

Conclusion

With just a few lines of Python and FastAPI, we built two collaborating microservices with clear responsibilities and simple interaction via HTTP. This pattern underpins many real-world distributed architectures, making it a great learning foundation for building maintainable and scalable systems.

Try extending these agents on your own use case!

entry.title: HOW TO CHANGE MASS OBJECTS/TABLE BY MASS T-CODE?
entry.content:
As we have tools to create mass data on SAP, such as LSMW (for migration purposes), etc. However, MASS is created by and used SAP S4/HANA => in order to do similar changes to all of the fields of an object. For example, you want to mass change the texts of material, or you want to do mass change to similar materials to all the sales order, or you want to mark delivery completed to all Purchase orders, etc



In this case, we have to know each Object Type that related to the data we want to change. For example, in this case, we want to change the Sales Order, so we choose BUS2032

For the object we want to use and want to change, we can check on the t-code MASSOBJ to input the Object we want to change and details related to the Object. Since using MASSOBJ t-code is cross-client, please be careful do additional setup to this tcode. As I can show you the detail related to BUS2032- Sales order:

 

 

 

As you can see, the detail tables/fields of Sales order could be seen here easily.

Letâ€™s get back to the MASS t-code.

 

  1. Input object type that needs to changeâ€ƒ
  2. As you can see, there are a lot of options to mass change the sales order, at tables level, or fields level

    Table level

    â€ƒ

     


    Field level

     

  3. In this example, we will mass change header data of Sales orders => click execute

     



    As you can see, we also have options that â€œImport Data from Fileâ€ for large amount of data that we need to change

  4. Input the needed data here, as you can see, MASS do support to create new data



    We can go through the details and see how the change applied by click on â€œDisplay All Recordsâ€ or Chg. In Background.

     


    Chg. In Background is used in this case.

  5. As you can see, there are many fields related to Sales Order Header Level as imagine below. In this case, I choose the reference field:

  6. As you can see below, we can do mass changes as below
    .

     

    I will input "DAVE" as New value


    Click Transfer => Field get updated

  7. As you can see on the table view and on the log changes of Sales order:

    Change log below:


As MASS tool is a very powerful tool/t-code to change mass object, please keep in mind that this change could impact both master data and transactional data. You could engage it first on testing environment before running it on production to make sure the field you change is correct.

Thank you and have a nice day,

Dave

entry.title: Re: sapcs?serverInfo
entry.content:
I eventually got this figured out after trying multiple approaches.

C:\usr\sap\KP9\SYS\profile\cs.conf       is the correct location for my Content Server 7.54 configuration file

The Software Provisioning Tool created the entire path, but they did not create the cs.conf file.  It would have been nice if they had also created an empty cs.conf file with a comment in the file telling me to use appropriate SAP Notes to manually convert my old ContentServer.ini configuration settings to the appropriate syntax for the new Content Server 7.54.

The problem with the http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo not working was due to a non-existent cs.conf file.  Additionally, I learned later, that the http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo test will not work if cs.conf has "Security=1" set

entry.title: Request for Method to Delete or Adjust Transactions in In-House Bank Account Balances
entry.content:
We would like to confirm if there is a way to delete or adjust transactions registered in the in-house bank account balances.

When importing MT940 statements, we update the virtual account balances based on the information provided in the memo line.
However, in this case, incorrect information was included in the memo line, which resulted in an unintended transaction being created in the in-house bank account.

We would like to know if there is a way to correct this transaction.
For example, is it possible to create a reversal transaction for the same amount with the opposite sign, or to invalidate the transaction in some way?

Thank you for your support.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Request for Method to Delete or Adjust Transactions i...
entry.content: You can reverse the wrongly posted bank statement items in the Reprocess Bank Statement Items and Reprocess Lockbox Items app. Kindly refer to the SAP Help Portal How to Reverse Postings

entry.title: Re: sapcs?serverInfo
entry.content:
The original command, http://<my_server_name>:1090/ContentServer/ContentServer.dll?serverInfo, was still working because it was connecting to the old Content Server 6.5 which I had not stopped yet.

To get the new command, http://<my_server_name>:1090/sapcs?serverInfo to work, I had to correctly configure the new cs.conf file, stop the old Content Server 6.5 and start the new Content Server 7.54.

In addition, I had to have Security=0 to get the http:// commands to work.

entry.title: Onboarding Documents Restrict Access
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In Onboarding 2.0 within the Onboarding Dashboard under an onboardee there is an 'Actions' option from where we can access 'Onboarding Documents'.

 

Is it possible to restrict certain types of documents from appearing on that list?

For example, I would like one HR Manager to be able to see all the generated and signed documents, but for a different HR Officer to be able to see only certain documents (e.g. signed Policy Docs, but not be able to see Signed Contracts).

Is there a way to achieve this?

 

I have tried RBP, disabling the 'View Documents Permission' will completely remove the option of 'Onboarding Documents' which is not ideal in this case.

Also I have tried 'Document Category Access' and selected specific category of document but it also does not seem to be working.  The HR officer could see documents that were not listed on the permission.

Can anyone share some knowledge if this is achievable or if there is a workaround?

 

Thanks!

entry.title: Display String function not working in CR 2025
entry.content:
Long time user of CR 2013, currently testing CR 2025.

Placed a Formula Field ({Command.STATUS}, it's a single-character text string)  within a report header section.

Right click on the field, select Format Field, then select the X2 formula button next to Display String: on the Common tab.

Enter formula:

  'Part Status: ' + {Command.STATUS}

Click Save.  The X2 formula button is now red indicating the presence of a formatting formula.  If I click the X2 button, I can see that my formula is still there.

Click OK to close the Format Editor.  Report does not show the new display string.  Re-open Format Editor; the X2 button is no longer red and if I click it, my format formula is gone.

This is a simple task that I have repeated probably thousands of times.  Why is it not working?

entry.title: Re: SAP TM Transportation Proposal
entry.content:
Hi @Marco89 

Thank you for your question.

Based on your explanations, you seem to be on the right track with your SAP TM configuration, especially recognizing the value of multi-stage routing.

Yes, it is possible to generate transportation proposals in SAP TM without using the VSR Optimizer but there are some limitations in achieving that. While basic proposals can be handled manually, multi-stage or alternative routing options like A-->C-->D-->B and A-->C-->E-->B typically require the Optimizer to evaluate and propose the most efficient combinations dynamically.

Without the optimizer, SAP TM wonâ€™t be able to automatically generate all possible route combinations unless theyâ€™re explicitly predefined in your master data.

I suggest you do the following:

  • Define all relevant locations and transshipment points.
  • Set up trade lanes and transportation lanes for each segment (A-->C, C-->D, D-->B, etc.).
  • Assign valid carriers and schedules.
  • Configure the transportation proposal settings correctly in SPRO.

Youâ€™ll find transportation proposals limited to these manually defined paths and wonâ€™t get optimization-based proposals such as cost/time comparison without the VSR engine.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Flexible workflow approver of Lean service sheet base...
entry.content:
Hi @GKestowicz 

Thank you for your question. I will walk you through possible solution.

In standard SAP S/4HANA on-premise 2023 edition, the Flexible Workflow currently provides condition-based routing primarily for Account Assignment Category = P. This uses standard fields like Project Definition or Responsible Person.

Unfortunately, approver determination based on the Network (category = N) is not directly supported through standard configuration.

However, there is a feasible solution and below is my recommendation:

You can implement a custom BADI, such as:

  • Use the â€œSWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVALâ€ to define a custom workflow condition.
  • Then use â€œWSBFI_FLEX_WF_AGENTSâ€ to determine the approver dynamically based on the network responsible or the related attributes.

Please note that this approach will allow you to do the following:

  • Extract the network number from the entry sheet.
  • Map it to the appropriate responsible person or org unit.
  • Route the workflow accordingly.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: 2 Outbound Delivery getting Created for 2 Line item o...
entry.content:
Hi @SAI098 

Thank you for your message. Though the questions is not very clear, I believe I understand what your issue is.

Your observation is clear. In SAP standard behaviour, the system creates separate deliveries when requirement dates differ across components in the Purchase Order. This is controlled by delivery split criteria in the delivery creation logic.

Suggestion on how to solve it:

Ensure that all components within the PO line items have the same requirement date maintained under the Material tab in item details.
This ensures the system recognizes the items as deliverable together, allowing them to be grouped into a single delivery.

These actions can be carried out by:

  • Transaction: ME22N (Change Purchase Order)
  • Select line item Ã  Go to Item Details Ã  Material Data tab
  • Align the requirement dates across all components

Once aligned, the system should generate a single delivery without a split. This will happen only if no other split criteria for example â€œship-to party, plant, storage locationâ€ are triggered.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Wrong Diff Quantity shown in EWM Monitor for Physical...
entry.content:
Hi @RajathRM 

Thank you for reaching out. I will walk you through.

You seem to be observing for Batch 01092026, the Book Quantity = 70, but the Counted Quantity = 72, yet the Diff. Qty = 70, which is clearly incorrect. Similarly, for other entries, differences don't reconcile logically.

Based on your screenshot and description, the difference quantity is likely caused by either batch-related split records, recounts not yet posted, or inconsistencies between counted and book quantities not reflected due to buffering. It is not a bug, but rather a data state issue.

I recommend you carry out the following steps:

  1. Run Report RM07I001 to check inconsistencies in inventory documents.
  2. Execute transaction MI24 to see the correct difference report.
  3. Review movement history in MB51 for the material and batches involved.
  4. Check for open recounts in MI22 and make sure they are posted correctly.
  5. Ensure no pending WM activities for example â€œpending TOs in LT24â€ if you are using WM.

If after you have carried out all checks the values still appear incorrect in LX17 or MI20, you can use report RIMODGEN to regenerate the physical inventory data.

 

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Can ex-post forecast values for each historical perio...
entry.content:
Hi @Brandon_Jones 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, it is possible to store ex-post forecast values for each historical period in a dedicated key figure during the Test Phase in SAP IBP. This can be very helpful for evaluating model performance and refining forecasting strategies.

I suggest you take this approach:

  1. Define your required custom key figure for example â€œKF_EX_POST_FORECASTâ€, with the appropriate planning levels and time granularity.
  2. Then, configure the forecast model in the Forecasting application to store the ex-post forecast results. Make sure to use the following:
    • Forecast Output Key Figure Mapping in the model configuration.
    • Assign the ex-post values to the custom key figure.
  3. Afterwards, ensure that your error calculation horizon aligns with the test horizon to enable a defined period-by-period comparisons.
  4. You also have the option to configure an analytics chart or use Excel UI to display the actual vs. ex-post forecast for each historical period.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Best Custom Packaging Company in USA in 2025?
entry.content:
Hi @jenniferjames 

Thanks for sharing your experience

This is indeed becoming a hot topic with the rise of personalized and sustainable packaging in eCommerce and omni-channel fulfillment.

Here are my answers to your questions:

  1. Integration with External Packaging Vendors

Yes, it is possible to integrate external packaging providers like Packaging Unit with SAP EWM. Please note that it often requires a mix of custom APIs and master data synchronization:

  • Packaging Material Master Data. You can create packaging materials in SAP ERP/EWM and sync them with the vendorâ€™s system via iDocs or REST APIs.
  • Regarding automatic Packing, EWM can propose packing instructions via Packing specifications which can then be extended to include vendor packaging options.
  1. Auto-Creation of Packaging in Outbound Deliveries
  • Using Packing Specifications and Condition Technique, EWM is able to automatically determine the correct packaging material based on product dimensions, weight, and order volume.
  • Some companies connect external packaging tools (like Cape Pack, or custom vendor APIs) to feed optimal cartonization data directly into their EWM during wave planning.
  1. Tools & Tips
  • SAP CPI is a good middleware for integrating vendors like Packaging Unit.
  • Handling Unit Templates in EWM can store vendor-specific packaging logic, for example branded boxes.
  • I suggest you consider leveraging BRF+ in EWM to dynamically select packaging types based on customer or sales channel. This is very useful for branded or eco-friendly packaging.

I hope this gives you clarity. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to Cascade Production Cuts from a Semi-Finished P...
entry.content:
Hi @SAPEY_AO 

Thanks for your question. Let me walk you through it.

Please note, within SAP IBP S&OP (without activating Supply & Response), manual adjustments to the production plan for a semi-finished product do not automatically cascade to finished products.

To answer your question: Can Production Cut at Semi-Finished Level Cascade to Finished Goods?

This doe does not happen automatically and here is why:

  • In an IBP S&OP setup without Supply & Response, adjusting your semi-finished product plan does not automatically reduce the dependent demand or production plan for finished goods even if there's a BOM relationship.
  • This behaviour is confirmed in SAP Community Q&A where planners note that manual changes to semi-finished items are not reflected downstream unless Supply & Response or Supply Planning is also activated.

The heuristic treats changes at each level independently. That means without Supply Planning logic, the finished goods plan remains unchanged.

Here are the reasons:

  • The S&OP heuristic propagates demand and supply based on sourcing rules, but it does not re-calculate dependent demand when there are manual cuts at higher levels.
  • No visibility or enforcement of capacity constraints at component levels since supply planning features are disabled.

Here is my suggestion (workaround) on how to align them, consider:

  • Manually reducing demand or production for impacted finished products.
  • Using adjustment key figures to simulate the impact downstream.
  • Applying BOM logic via custom formulas or Excel operators.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Lag Based Snapshot Operator - Batch Size is 0 | Snaps...
entry.content:
Hi @MallikarjunB 

Thanks for the detailed breakdown.

The â€œBatch size is 0â€ error in the Lag-Based Snapshot operator typically means thereâ€™s no valid data matching the operator settings. This often due to:

  • The target key figure doesnâ€™t have Lag as a root attribute in its base planning level.
  • The planning level itself doesnâ€™t include Lag.
  • The defined lags may not align with your data or master data setup.

Here is what I suggest:

  1. Open Manage Planning Area â€“> ensure your planning level contains Lag.
  2. Confirm your target key figure uses that same planning level.
  3. Use the Manage Lag-Based Snapshot Profiles app to verify your snapshot profile setup (source, target, defined lags).

Once you have properly configured Lag and aligned across planning level, KF, and operator profile, the snapshot will execute with valid batch size and appear in Excel.

I hope this helps you solve the issue. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos to this post. Your support is appreciated.

Best regards

Chris

entry.content:

Thank you for reaching out.

youâ€™re right to note that Initial stock and Inventory Correction are only relevant in Time-Series planning.

Please note that for OBP to be executed correctly, stock must be introduced as external receipt orders, for example via Excel or OData and not via key figures.

I suggest you:

  • Then these orders will be fully recognized by the finite heuristic
  • For frequent use, consider defining virtual locations in S/4 and replicating them to IBP

entry.content:
Hello @Keratiya_D 

You are welcome,

To upload Excel data into the system, please follow below

  • OData APIs like API_SALES_ORDER_SRV are available in SAP S/4HANA Public cloud and support data upload via JSON/XML, not Excel directly.
  • To use Excel, you must convert the file to JSON/XML and send it via POST.
  • For business users, standard Fiori apps,like Upload General Journal Entries for General Ledger Accountant -App ID F2548  or Custom Business Objects/App ID-F1712  are better for direct Excel uploads.
  • SAP doesnâ€™t support classic file-based BAPI uploads in Public Cloud.

You can also refer to below SAP Documentation
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Extensibility Help

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Unable to Clear Special G/L Transactions with CME Ind...
entry.content:
Hello @Blas4 @

Good question! Special G/L indicator S is typically used for down payment requests, while A is used for actual down payments.

Please check the configuration in SSCUI 101044 â€“ Configure Payment Methods for Country/Company Code, and make sure:

  • The payment method allows Special G/L transactions.
  • The indicator S is supported for your posting scenario.

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, the use of special G/L indicators is predefined, so if you're posting an actual down payment, you should use A instead of S.

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Price change of Material by Fiori app Manage Material...
entry.content:
Hello @ai_takahashi 

Since release 2105, the price change carried over to current period behaviour is standard and non-configurable in SAP S4 Public cloud. This means that any price change posted in a closed period is automatically applied in the current period and cannot be reversed, including via FB08.

This behaviour supports period consistency and aligns with the cloud fit-to-standard approach.

For IFRS compliance where reversals may be required youâ€™ll need to handle such adjustments via parallel ledgers (e.g., 0L for IFRS) or manual postings, rather than reversing the material valuation itself.

Manage Material Valuations-App ID: F2680

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate E-Invoice India in sap public cloud...
entry.content:
Hello @Sanjay_BS1 

To integrate e-invoicing in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud 3SL, activate the relevant scope item for example (5XU, 5EJ), set up communication arrangements (SAP_COM_0638), maintain output determination (EDOC_OUTPUT, channel XML), and use Manage eDocuments for processing.

direct SAP Help Portal link for Document and Reporting Compliance(e-invoicing) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Defining Localizations and Scope-SAP Learning

KBA 3495570 - Clarification on XML / IDOC / EDI S/4hana output control (BRF+) channels and comparing to NAST-based logic's mediums 

With regards

Chuma
